steps.title: Feeling to release
steps.description: Which feeling would you like to release with me today?

steps.title: Eliciting ${s0} - background
steps.description: In all your years on this odd planet, you had some experiences that you felt ${s0} about, some more than others, correct?

steps.title: Eliciting ${s0} - background
steps.description: So think of something that happened in the past, which you still feel ${s0} about

steps.title: Eliciting ${s0} - the chosen one
steps.description:
***“One? I have plenty!”***

Great! So the change would be more impactful for you. Pick the one that still bothers you the most, or still has the most “sting” to it.

answers.text: Not sure if it’s the strongest one, but I got one

steps.title: Eliciting ${s0} - description
steps.description:
As you think of that now, notice what image comes to mind, and describe it to me a little bit

I don’t need the details, just a title for reference would do, i.e. “Fight with a friend two years ago”
steps.inputPlaceholder: The title of the image is ...

steps.title: Eliciting ${s0}
steps.description:
${echo}

OK, we’ll call that the “cue”. Now you can put that cue experience aside for now, we’ll use it soon.

answers.text: I've set it aside, what's next?

steps.title: Corrective action
steps.description:
Is there some corrective action you can take to “improve the situation” or “make amends”, or what’s left is just to release the emotion/feeling of ${s0}?

 Maybe you already did this, or there’s nothing else to physically “do”, and you know logically it’s “over”, and what’s left is for your emotions to sort of catch up with your logic.

answers.text: There is something I can do
I just want to release the feeling

steps.title: Corrective action - thing
steps.description:
***“There is something I can do”***

Great, what is it?

 I don’t need the details, just a title for reference will do, i.e. “talk to my friend”

steps.title: Corrective action - time
steps.description:
${echo}

And when would be an appropriate time to take this corrective action?

steps.title: Corrective action - future pacing
steps.description:
Run that in your mind now, doing that corrective action:
*“${s7}”*

In that time:
*“${s8}”*

And notice what do you feel experiencing it

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step
I want to make some adjustments

steps.title: Eliciting resource
steps.description:
Now think of something that you used to feel ${s0} about in the past, but as you think of it now, it’s ok, and you are at peace with it.

Something that used to bother you in a similar way, but now as you think of it it’s like *“eh, no biggie / it’s in the past / etc”*. Come people like to call it “resolved ${s0}”

steps.title: Eliciting resource - give yourself a break
steps.description:
***“Nothing comes to mind”***

Usually this happens because people set the bar too high, like looking for that one grandiose past experience of ${s0}, which is now resolved. So give yourself a little break ;)

And go for something smaller / less significant. Think back through your early days, the different episodes in your life, different places you’ve been, things you’ve done, people you’ve met, relationships you had, activities you’ve done.

Remember everything we do is reversible, we are just exploring, and we can always do this again with a different experience. Whatever comes to mind now, go with it. At the end, if you won’t come to a full resolution, we’ll talk about it. Promise :)

answers.text: Gave myself a break, now I got one

steps.title: Eliciting resource - description
steps.description:
Good, and as you think of that now, notice what image comes to mind, and describe it to me a little bit.

 I don’t need the details, just a title for reference would do, i.e. “age 11 at sports class”

steps.title: Eliciting resource - validating

answers.text: Actually, let me choose another one

steps.title: Eliciting resource
steps.description: OK, we’ll call this the “resource”. It’s going to come in handy real soon

steps.title: Congruence check
steps.description:
So you have the resource:
*“${s12}”*

And the cue:
*“${s4}”*

Do you have any objections to experience the cue, in the same way you experience the resource?

I.e. with more peace/resolution, coming to terms with it, etc

**Note**: we will cover safety mechanisms for the future after we’ll transform/soften this experience, to make sure you know how to better avoid this situation in the future.

answers.text: I would LOVE to experience the cue like that

steps.title: Congruence check
steps.description:
${echo}

Great. That’s usually the case, let’s proceed then

steps.title: Content distortions - self
steps.description:
As you look at the cue experience:
*“${s4}”*

Are you in regular life size in that experience?

Sometimes people would see themselves smaller or larger than life size in experiences like these, or they would be smaller / larger than life size.

steps.title: Content distortions
steps.description:
${echo}

OK, now notice what happens as you allow yourself to get back to regular life size

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Content distortions - others
steps.description: If there are other people in that experience, are they in regular life size?

answers.text: There are others, they are life size
There are others, they are bigger than life size
There are others, they are smaller than life size

steps.title: Content distortions - others
steps.description:
${echo}

OK, now notice what happens as you allow whoever is involved, to get back to regular life size

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Content distortions - misc
steps.description:
Are there any other content distortions you notice?

Maybe someone has no cloth on, or has a blank spot on them, or something similar.

answers.text: I don’t notice any other distortions
There are more distortions I notice

steps.title: Content distortions - misc
steps.description: Great observation, now notice what happens as you allow those distortions to disappear, so you see the image in its appropriate form

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis
steps.description:
Now as you think about both of these at the same time:

**The resource:**
${s12}

**And the cue:**
${s4}

Attend to the differences in how you see, hear, and experience them in your mind.

As you go back and forth between the two a few times, notice the visual, auditory, and tactile differences between the way you experience them.

What are the main differences you see, hear, and feel between the two? Write down all differences you can already notice.
steps.inputPlaceholder: The differences I already notice are ...

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis - location & distance
steps.description:
Now check, as you look at the resource image and the cue image, are the images in the same place in your physical space?

For example you might see one image further away to your left, while the the other will be closer and to your right.

answers.text: One image is closer than the other
One image is higher than the other
One image is more to my right and the other to my left
One image is more in front of me than the other
The images are in the exact same place

steps.title: Contrastive Analysis - location & distance
steps.description:
***“The images are in the exact same place”***

While it does happen that the images are in the same place and distance to begin with, it is very rare, so I just want to be thorough here, with your permission.

I want you to look again at the **resource image** again:
*${s12}*

Then at the **cue image** again:
*${s4}*

And go back and forth between the two a few times. Then close your eyes and point at the location you see each of them.

Are you pointing to the **exact same place**, and the images are the **exact same distance** from you?

answers.text: I’m pointing to the exact same place
I’m pointing to two different places

steps.title: Mapping Across - location & distance
steps.description:
Now notice what happens as you allow the cue image, to slide to the same location of the resource image.

So you see both images in the same location and distance from you.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - brightness / dimness
steps.description:
Next notice what happens as you allow the cue image to become as bright (or as dim) as the resource image.

So you see both images in the same brightness/dimness.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - depth(3d)
steps.description:
Now notice what happens as you allow the cue image to become as deep/flat as the resource image.

So you see both images in the same depth.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - vividness & focus
steps.description:
Next notice what happens as you allow the cue image to become as vivid and focused as the resource image.

So you see both images in the same vividness & focus.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - sound
steps.description:
Do any of the images have sound?

Voice, background noises, music, or any type of sound.

steps.title: Mapping Across - sound
steps.description:
***“Both have sound”***

Notice what happens as you allow the sound of the cue image, to become like the sound of the resource image.

So you hear both of them in the same way. Same sound quality, tempo, tone, volume, direction, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - sound
steps.description:
***“Cue does, resource doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you allow the cue image to become muted as well.

Like in a tv remote, as you press the “mute” button, or the “decrease volume” all the way to zero.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - sound
steps.description:
***“Resource has, cue doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you turn on the sound in the cue image, and allow it to become like the sound of the resource image.

Like in a tv remote, as you press the “mute/unmute” button, or the “increase volume” all the way to zero. So you hear both of them in the same way. Same sound quality, tempo, tone, direction, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - tactile / touch
steps.description:
Do any of the images have tactile sensations or a sense of touch?

I.e. you feel someone’s touch, something touching your skin, etc

steps.title: Mapping Across - tactile / touch
steps.description:
***“Both have tactile”***

Notice what happens as you allow the tactile sensations of the cue image, to become like the tactile sensations of the resource image.

So you feel the touch in both of them in the same way. Same texture, temperature, softness/stiffness, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - tactile / touch
steps.description:
***“Cue does, resource doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you allow the tactile sensation of the cue image to drain away, and become touchless/tactiless as well.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - tactile / touch
steps.description:
***“Resource has, cue doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you start feeling the sense of touch in the cue image, and allow it to become like the sense of touch in the resource image.

So you feel the touch in both of them in the same way. Same texture, temperature, softness/stiffness, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping Across - remaining differences
steps.description:
Remaining differences

Now go back and forth between both images and scan for remaining differences.

Is there anything else in the way you experience the resource, which you'd like to apply to the cue?

**Resource:**
*"${s12}"*

**Cue:**
*"${s4}"*

answers.text: I don't notice any remaining differences
I notice some differences I want to apply
I notice some differences I don't want to apply

steps.title: Mapping Across - remaining differences
steps.description:
***“I noticed some differences I want to apply”***

Good observation, what remaining differences do you notice?

steps.title: Mapping Across - remaining differences
steps.description:
${echo}

Apply them as well now and notice what happens

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - color
steps.description:
As you think of this experience you just transformed now:

*${s4}*

Try making it B&W/grayscale, and decrease the colorfulness, and notice how much it increases the peace and acceptance

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Fading out
steps.description:
Now try fading it out a bit, and notice how much increases the peace and acceptance

Allow it to fade out completely, then start fading it in, so you find your sweet spot.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Transparency
steps.description:
Now try fading it out a bit, and notice how much it increases the peace and acceptance

Allow it to fade out completely, then start fading it in, so you find your sweet spot.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Zoom out
steps.description:
Next try “zooming out” the experience. The image itself would still be at the same plane, and the same distance from you, but the content of the images would zoom out.

It sometimes helps to think of a camera or taking a photo with your smartphone. You can zoom out the camera, so the screen is still in the same distance from you, but the image on the screen is zoomed out.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Distance
steps.description:
Next allow it to get further into the distance, to a point you still see it but much less, and notice how much it increases the peace and acceptance

Allow it to get waaaaaay far into the distance, then start pulling it back a bit closer, so you find your sweet spot.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Still & flat
steps.description: If it's not already a still flat image, make it still and flat, and notice how much it increases the peace and acceptance

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Frame
steps.description:
Now how about putting a frame around that pic?

Try different frames, see if anything works for you

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Lamination & glass
steps.description: Next experiment with different lamination and glass over the image, and notice how much it increases the peace and acceptance

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Muting
steps.description: If there's sound or voices that goes with the image, try muting it and notice if you prefer it that way

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Tactile
steps.description: If there's a sense of touch to the image, or any other tactile sensation, remove it and notice if you prefer it that way

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Word, date, album
steps.description:
Now some people found it appropriate to add a word(s) to the image, or a date. It could be on the image itself somewhere, above it, to the side or below.

Some people also like to put the image in a photo album in their mind.

The words can be written in an artistic way, with decorations (gold is common). If this doesn't make sense to you or doesn't appeal to you, skip it. If you are not sure, the best way to find out is to experiment.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Additional changes
steps.description:
Now take a moment to play the “director” role, notice if there are any further changes you'd like to make. Something you'd like to add or embellish in anyway.

We can always revise this later of course, and there's no "right or wrong" here.

answers.text: Nothing comes to mind at the moment
Hmm … There’s something I want to try

steps.title: Increasing peace & acceptance - Additional changes
Increasing peace & acceptance - Additional changes
steps.description:
${echo}

Now notice what happens as you allow that change to take place now.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Learnings & insights
steps.description:
Looking back at the experience you just transformed:

*${s4}*

Are there any learnings you can pick up from it now? Any insights? Spontaneous realizations?

Sometimes our emotions get in the way of our logic & thinking, and it’s easier to learn from a situation once it’s softer and more resolved. So examine that experience again now:

*${s4}*

And get a sense if there’s some value or learnings you can adopt to your future behavior.

answers.text: I’ve already learned everything I could from it
Oh yes, there are some things I could adopt

steps.title: Learnings & insights
steps.description:
***“Had some spontaneous realizations!”***

Oh yes, I LOVE those! :)

I would love to hear them, tho your privacy comes before my whims, so if you want to keep them to yourself, just write titles for reference.

steps.title: Learnings & insights
steps.description:
***“Oh yes, there are some things I could adopt”***

Great, what are those?

I would love to hear them, tho your privacy comes before my whims, so if you want to keep them to yourself, just write titles for reference.

steps.title: Congruence Check
steps.description:
Looking back at the experience you just transformed:

*${s4}*

Do you have any objections being this way, experiencing it like that?
